page.title: 20The Origin of Princetown
page.content: About 1Km outside the village of Princetown, on the road to Whiteworks lies Tor Royal farm. This was the home of Sir Thomas Tyrwhitt who first established the farm in 1785. It is to this man that Princetown and Dartmoor Prison owe their origin. It was his idea to try and convert the barren moorland into fertile farms and build a model town He was not very successful with his farming but the re-start of the war with France and his idea of the building of a war prison were the beginnings of Princetown, which was named after the Prince Regent. Tor Royal is still worked as a Dartmoor farm but some of the outbuildings have been converted into small workshops by COSIRA. There is a memorial plaque to Sir Thomas in the church.
